title: 28 Funny Jokes to Tell Your Girlfriend

steps.title: “What did one raspberry say to the other? I love you berry much.”[1] X Research source
steps.content: “What did one raspberry say to the other? I love you berry much.” [1] X Research source

steps.title: “What did the magnet say to the fridge? You’re attractive.”
steps.content: “What did the magnet say to the fridge? You’re attractive.”

steps.title: “What did the barista say to their crush? I like you a latte.”
steps.content: “What did the barista say to their crush? I like you a latte.”

steps.title: “What flower is the best at kissing? Tulips.”
steps.content: “What flower is the best at kissing? Tulips.”

steps.title: “Never date an apostrophe. They’re possessive.”
steps.content: “Never date an apostrophe. They’re possessive.”

steps.title: “Is your name WiFi? Because I feel a connection.”
steps.content: “Is your name WiFi? Because I feel a connection.”

steps.title: “What do you call insects that are dating? Answer: Love bugs.”[2] X Research source
steps.content: “What do you call insects that are dating? Answer: Love bugs.” [2] X Research source

steps.title: “How did the telephone ask its girlfriend out? It gave her a ring.”
steps.content: “How did the telephone ask its girlfriend out? It gave her a ring.”

steps.title: “What’s the most romantic ship? Courtship.”
steps.content: “What’s the most romantic ship? Courtship.”

steps.title: “Are you a parking ticket? Because you’ve got fine written all over you.”
steps.content: “Are you a parking ticket? Because you’ve got fine written all over you.”

steps.title: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Olive. Olive who? Olive you!”[3] X Research source
steps.content: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Olive. Olive who? Olive you!” [3] X Research source

steps.title: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Kiss. Kiss who? Kiss me!”[4] X Research source
steps.content: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Kiss. Kiss who? Kiss me!” [4] X Research source

steps.title: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Orange. Orange who? Orange you stunning!”
steps.content: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Orange. Orange who? Orange you stunning!”

steps.title: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Cheese. Cheese who? Cheese, you're awfully cute!”[5] X Research source
steps.content: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Cheese. Cheese who? Cheese, you're awfully cute!” [5] X Research source

steps.title: “What did the light bulb say to the switch? You turn me on!”
steps.content: “What did the light bulb say to the switch? You turn me on!”

steps.title: “What did the calculator say to the pen? You can always count on me!”
steps.content: “What did the calculator say to the pen? You can always count on me!”

steps.title: “What did the squirrel say to its lover? I’m nuts for you!”
steps.content: “What did the squirrel say to its lover? I’m nuts for you!”

steps.title: “Why did the melons get married in a church? Because they cantaloupe.”
steps.content: “Why did the melons get married in a church? Because they cantaloupe.”

steps.title: “Why shouldn’t you break up with a goalie? Because they’re a keeper.”[6] X Research source
steps.content: “Why shouldn’t you break up with a goalie? Because they’re a keeper.” [6] X Research source

steps.title: “Where do hotdogs go on a date? The meatball.”
steps.content: “Where do hotdogs go on a date? The meatball.”

steps.title: “Why are forks disappointed on Valentine’s Day? They just wanted to spoon.”
steps.content: “Why are forks disappointed on Valentine’s Day? They just wanted to spoon.”

steps.title: “What did the two prunes call their dinner plans? A date.”
steps.content: “What did the two prunes call their dinner plans? A date.”

steps.title: “They say kissing is a love language. Do you want to start a conversation?”
steps.content: “They say kissing is a love language. Do you want to start a conversation?”

steps.title: “You must be a banana because you’re very a-peeling.”
steps.content: “You must be a banana because you’re very a-peeling.”

steps.title: “Ouch! I must have scraped my knee falling for you.”
steps.content: “Ouch! I must have scraped my knee falling for you.”

steps.title: “Did it hurt when you fell from heaven?”
steps.content: “Did it hurt when you fell from heaven?”

steps.title: “I’m going to arrest you for robbery because you’ve stolen my heart.”
steps.content: “I’m going to arrest you for robbery because you’ve stolen my heart.”

steps.title: “If I could rearrange the alphabet, I’d put U and I together.”[7] X Research source
steps.content: “If I could rearrange the alphabet, I’d put U and I together.” [7] X Research source
